<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>117</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=119,EFW="2167326",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=280073,FOLIO='117',FILE='DISK130:[06ATA3.06ATA1033]EU1033A.;15',USER='SCAVALI',CD='28-FEB-2006;11:09' -->
<A NAME="page_eu1033_1_118"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm<BR>
Board of Directors and Shareowners<BR>  </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>The Coca-Cola Company  </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of The Coca-Cola Company and subsidiaries as of December&nbsp;31, 2005 and 2004, and
the related consolidated statements of income, shareowners' equity, and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2005. Our audits also included the financial
statement schedule listed in the Index at Item 15(a). These financial statements and schedule are the responsibility of the Company's management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these
financial statements and schedule based on our audits. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to
obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in
the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement
presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
our opinion, the financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated financial position of The Coca-Cola Company and
subsidiaries at December&nbsp;31, 2005 and 2004, and the consolidated results of their operations and their cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, in
conformity with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles. Also, in our opinion, the related financial statement schedule, when considered in relation to the basic financial statements taken as a
whole, presents fairly in all material respects the information set forth therein. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
discussed in Note&nbsp;1 to the consolidated financial statements, in 2004 the Company adopted the provisions of FASB Interpretation No.&nbsp;46 (revised December&nbsp;2003)
regarding the consolidation of variable interest entities. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
also have audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the effectiveness of The Coca-Cola Company and
subsidiaries' internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2005, based on criteria established in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Internal Control&#151;Integrated
Framework</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission and our report dated February&nbsp;24, 2006, expressed an unqualified opinion
thereon. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>118</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=120,EFW="2167326",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=670393,FOLIO='118',FILE='DISK130:[06ATA3.06ATA1033]EU1033A.;15',USER='SCAVALI',CD='28-FEB-2006;11:09' -->
<A NAME="page_eu1033_1_119"> </A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm<BR>
on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Board of Directors and Shareowners<BR>  </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>The Coca-Cola Company  </I></B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have audited management's assessment, included in the accompanying Report of Management on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting, that The
Coca-Cola Company and subsidiaries maintained effective internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2005, based on criteria established in </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Internal Control&#151;Integrated Framework</I></FONT><FONT
SIZE=2> issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (the COSO criteria).
The Coca-Cola Company's management is responsible for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting and for its assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over
financial reporting. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on management's assessment and an opinion on the effectiveness of the Company's internal control over financial reporting based on our
audit. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to
obtain reasonable assurance about whether effective internal control over financial reporting was maintained in all material respects. Our audit included obtaining an understanding of internal control
over financial reporting, evaluating management's assessment, testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control, and performing such other procedures as we considered
necessary in the circumstances. We believe that our audit provides a reasonable basis for our opinion. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
company's internal control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of
financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. A company's internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures
that (1)&nbsp;pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the company; (2)&nbsp;provide
reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and
expenditures of the company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the company; and (3)&nbsp;provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely
detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the company's assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Because
of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements. Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future
periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
our opinion, management's assessment that The Coca-Cola Company and subsidiaries maintained effective internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31,
2005, is fairly stated, in all
material respects, based on the COSO criteria. Also, in our opinion, The Coca-Cola Company and subsidiaries maintained, in all material respects, effective internal control over financial
reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2005, based on the COSO criteria. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
also have audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the consolidated balance sheets of The Coca-Cola
Company and subsidiaries as of December&nbsp;31, 2005 and 2004, and the related consolidated statements of income, shareowners' equity, and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended
December&nbsp;31, 2005, and our report dated February&nbsp;24, 2006, expressed an unqualified opinion thereon. </FONT></P>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
reporting period ends on the Friday closest to the last day of the quarterly calendar period. Our fiscal year ends on December&nbsp;31 regardless of the day of the week on which
December&nbsp;31 falls. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain
amounts previously reported in our 2005 and 2004 Quarterly Reports on Form&nbsp;10-Q were reclassified to conform to our year-end presentation. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company's first quarter of 2005 results were impacted by two fewer shipping days as compared to the first quarter of 2004. Additionally, the Company recorded the following
transactions which impacted results: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>

for taxes on unremitted foreign earnings of approximately $152&nbsp;million. Refer to Note&nbsp;16.

$22&nbsp;million of noncash pretax gains on issuances of stock by Coca-Cola Amatil in connection with the acquisition of SPC Ardmona
Pty.&nbsp;Ltd., an Australian fruit company. Refer to Note&nbsp;3.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>An
income tax benefit of approximately $56&nbsp;million related to the reversal of previously accrued taxes resulting from favorable resolution of tax matters. Refer to
Note&nbsp;16.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Approximately
$50&nbsp;million of accelerated amortization of stock-based compensation expense related to a change in our estimated service period for retirement-eligible
participants. Refer to Note&nbsp;14. </FONT></DD></DL>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ga1033_glossary"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ga1033_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>GLOSSARY    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As used in this report, the following terms have the meanings indicated. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Bottler or Bottling Partner:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>business that buys concentrates (sometimes referred to as "beverage bases") or syrups from the Company,
converts them into finished packaged products and sells them to customers. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Carbonated Soft Drink:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>nonalcoholic carbonated beverage (sometimes referred to as "soft drinks") containing flavorings and sweeteners.
Excludes, among others, waters and flavored waters, juice and juice drinks, sports drinks, and teas and coffees. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>The Coca-Cola System:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>the Company and its bottling partners. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Coca-Cola Trademark Beverages:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>cola-flavored Company Trademark Beverages bearing the Coca-Cola
trademark. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Company:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>The Coca-Cola Company together with its subsidiaries. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Company Trademark Beverages:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>beverages bearing our trademarks and certain other beverage products licensed to our Company for which our
Company provides marketing support and from the sale of which it derives income. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Concentrate:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>material manufactured from Company-defined ingredients and sold to bottlers to prepare finished beverages through the addition
of water and, depending on the product, sweeteners and/or carbonated water, marketed under trademarks of the Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Consumer:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>person who drinks Company products. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Cost of Capital:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>after-tax blended cost of equity and borrowed funds used to invest in operating capital required for business. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Customer:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>retail outlet, restaurant or other operation that sells or serves Company products directly to consumers. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Derivatives:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>contracts or agreements, the value of which may change based on changes in interest rates, exchange rates, prices of
securities, or financial or commodity indices. The Company uses derivatives to reduce our exposure to adverse fluctuations in interest and foreign currency exchange rates and other market risks. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Fountain:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>system used by retail outlets to dispense product into cups or glasses for immediate consumption. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Gallon:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>unit of physical volume measurement for concentrates (sometimes referred to as "beverage bases"), syrups, finished beverages and
powders (in all cases, expressed in equivalent gallons of syrup) sold by the Company to its bottling partners or other customers. Most of the Company's revenues are based on gallon sales, a measure of
primarily "wholesale" activity. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Gross Profit Margin:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>gross profit divided by net operating revenues. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Market:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>when used in reference to geographic areas, territory in which the Company and its bottling partners do business, often defined by
national boundaries. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Noncarbonated Beverages:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>nonalcoholic beverages without carbonation including, but not limited to, waters and flavored waters, juice and
juice drinks, sports drinks, and teas and coffees. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Operating Margin:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>operating income divided by net operating revenues. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Per Capita Consumption:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>average number of servings consumed per person, per year in a specific market. Per capita consumption of Company
beverage products is calculated by multiplying our unit case volume by 24, and dividing by the population. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Serving:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>eight U.S. fluid ounces of a finished beverage. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>122</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=124,EFW="2167326",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=994097,FOLIO='122',FILE='DISK130:[06ATA3.06ATA1033]GA1033A.;23',USER='SCAVALI',CD='28-FEB-2006;11:09' -->
<A NAME="page_ga1033_1_123"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Syrup:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>concentrate mixed with sweetener and water, sold to bottlers and customers who add carbonated water to produce finished carbonated
soft drinks. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Unit Case:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>unit of volume measurement equal to 192 U.S. fluid ounces of finished beverage (24 eight-ounce servings). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Unit Case Volume, or Volume:&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>the number of unit cases (or unit case equivalents) of Company beverage products directly or indirectly sold
by the Coca-Cola system to customers. Unit case volume primarily consists of beverage products bearing Company trademarks. Unit case volume also includes sales by joint ventures in which
the Company is a partner and beverage products licensed to, or distributed by, our Company, and brands owned by our bottling partners for which our Company provides marketing support and from the sale
of which it derives income. Such beverage products licensed to, or distributed by, our Company or owned by our bottling partners account for a minimal portion of total unit case volume. Unit case
volume is derived based on estimates received by the Company from its bottling partners and distributors. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>123</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=125,EFW="2167326",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="1",CHK=674344,FOLIO='123',FILE='DISK130:[06ATA3.06ATA1033]GA1033A.;23',USER='SCAVALI',CD='28-FEB-2006;11:09' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->

<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ITEM 9. CHANGES IN AND DISAGREEMENTS WITH ACCOUNTANTS ON ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL DISCLOSURE    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="gc1033_item_9a._controls_and_procedures"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_gc1033_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ITEM 9A. CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company, under the supervision and with the participation of its management, including the Chief Executive Officer and the Chief Financial Officer, evaluated
the effectiveness of the design and operation of the Company's "disclosure controls and procedures" (as defined in Rule&nbsp;13a-15(e) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as
amended (the "Exchange Act")) as of the end of the period covered by this report. Based on that evaluation, the Chief Executive Officer and the Chief Financial Officer concluded that the Company's
disclosure controls and procedures are effective in timely making known to them material information relating to the Company and the Company's consolidated subsidiaries required to be disclosed in the
Company's reports filed or submitted under the Exchange Act. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
report called for by Item 308(a) of Regulation&nbsp;S-K is incorporated herein by reference to Report of Management on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting,
included in Part&nbsp;II, "Item 8. Financial Statements and Supplementary Data" of this report. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
attestation report called for by Item 308(b) of Regulation&nbsp;S-K is incorporated herein by reference to Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm on
Internal Control Over Financial Reporting, included in Part&nbsp;II, "Item 8. Financial Statements and Supplementary Data" of this report. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There
has been no change in the Company's internal control over financial reporting during the quarter ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 that has materially affected, or is reasonably
likely to materially affect, the Company's internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></P>

<A NAME="toc_ge1033_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>PART III    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ge1033_item_10._directors_and___ge102276"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ge1033_2"> </A></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>ITEM 10. DIRECTORS AND EXECUTIVE OFFICERS OF THE REGISTRANT    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The information under the headings "Board of Directors," "Section&nbsp;16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance," "Information About the Board of
Directors and Corporate Governance&#151;The Audit Committee" and "Information About the Board of Directors and Corporate Governance&#151;The Board and Board Committees" in the Company's
2006 Proxy Statement is incorporated herein by reference. See Item X in Part&nbsp;I of this report for information regarding executive officers of the Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company has adopted a code of business conduct and ethics applicable to the Company's Directors, officers (including the Company's principal executive officer, principal financial
officer and controller) and employees, known as the Code of Business Conduct. The Code of Business Conduct is available on the Company's website. In the event that we amend or waive any of the
provisions of the Code of Business Conduct applicable to our principal executive officer, principal financial officer or controller that relates to any element of the code of ethics definition
enumerated in Item 406(b) of Regulation&nbsp;S-K, we intend to disclose the same on the Company's website at www.coca-cola.com. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
May&nbsp;16, 2005, we filed with the New York Stock Exchange ("NYSE") the Annual CEO Certification regarding the Company's compliance with the NYSE's Corporate Governance listing
standards as required by Section&nbsp;303A-12(a) of the NYSE Listed Company Manual. In addition, the Company has filed as exhibits to this annual report and to the annual report on
Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004, the applicable certifications of its Chief Executive Officer and its Chief Financial Officer required under Section&nbsp;302
of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, regarding the quality of the Company's public disclosures. </FONT></P>

NAME="ge1033_item_11._executive_compensation"> </A>

Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation," and the information under the principal heading "EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION" in the Company's 2006 Proxy Statement is incorporated herein by reference. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="gg1033_part_iv"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_gg1033_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>PART IV    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="gg1033_item_15._exhibits_and_financial_statement_schedules"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_gg1033_2"> </A></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>ITEM 15. EXHIBITS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENT SCHEDULES    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
following documents are filed as part of this report:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>

<SEQUENCE>2
<FILENAME>a2167326zex-10_106.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.10.6
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#06ATA1033_2">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 10.10.6  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kk1053_amendment_number_five_to_the_e__ame02964"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kk1053_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT NUMBER FIVE TO<BR>  THE EXECUTIVE MEDICAL PLAN OF<BR>  THE COCA-COLA COMPANY    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS AMENDMENT to the Executive Medical Plan of The Coca-Cola Company (the "Plan") is adopted by the Plan Administrator. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>W I T N E S S E T H:  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, Section&nbsp;10 of the Plan provides that the Plan Administrator may amend the Plan at any time; and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
the Plan Administrator wishes to amend the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
January&nbsp;1, 2006, Section&nbsp;12.4 shall be restated in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"12.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Establishment and Maintenance of Adequate Separation between the Company and Plan</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In accordance with the
requirements of HIPAA, only the employees/classes of employees identified by the Plan Administrator or its delegate, as set forth in a separate written document maintained by the Plan Administrator or
its delegate, will be given access to PHI to be used or disclosed. Such designated persons will only have access to and use PHI for purposes of Plan administration functions that the Company performs
for the Plan. Notwithstanding the amendment provisions of this Plan, the Plan Administrator or its delegate is hereby granted authority to amend the designated persons document from time to time as
necessary to facilitate payment or health care operations of the Plan. Any such amendment to the designated persons may apply prospectively or retroactively." </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the Plan Administrator has adopted this Amendment Number Five on the date shown below, but effective as of the dates indicated above. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<TYPE>EX-10.11.6
<SEQUENCE>3
<FILENAME>a2167326zex-10_116.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.11.6
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#06ATA1033_3">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_kl1053_1_1"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 10.11.6  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kl1053_amendment_five_to_the_suppleme__ame03511"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kl1053_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT FIVE TO THE SUPPLEMENTAL BENEFIT PLAN<BR>  AS AMENDED AND RESTATED EFFECTIVE JANUARY 1, 2002    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS AMENDMENT to The Coca-Cola Company Supplemental Benefit Plan (the "Plan") is adopted by The Coca-Cola Company Benefits Committee (the
"Committee"). </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>W I T N E S S E T H:  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, Section&nbsp;6.4 of the Plan provides that the Committee may amend the Plan at any time; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
the Committee wishes to amend the Plan in light of new tax legislation affecting deferred compensation plans, to change the application of eligible compensation for situations
involving an employee's death, and to change a provision dealing with distributions in the event of disability; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW,
THEREFORE, the Committee hereby amends the Plan as follows: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>1.
</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
October&nbsp;1, 2005, a new section&nbsp;3.1(a)(7) shall be added as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(7)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>For
purposes of calculating the Supplemental Pension Benefit under this section, eligible compensation shall be the same as the eligible compensation under the Qualified Pension Plan,
except that, solely for the purposes of this Plan, compensation shall also include any amounts paid after the death of an employee relating the Participant's employment that i)&nbsp;would have been
eligible compensation if paid to the Participant while living and ii)&nbsp;is payable under the terms of the applicable plan, program or agreement no later than the last day of the calendar month
following the calendar month in which the Participant dies. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
October&nbsp;1, 2005, a new section&nbsp;3.2(a)(3) shall be added as follow: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(3)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>For
purposes of calculating the Supplemental Thrift Benefit under this section, eligible compensation shall be the same as the eligible compensation under the Qualified Defined
Contribution Plan, except that, solely for the purposes of this Plan, compensation shall also include any amounts paid after the death of an employee relating the Participant's employment that
i)&nbsp;would have been eligible compensation if paid to the Participant while living and ii)&nbsp;is payable under the terms of the applicable plan, program or agreement no later than the last
day of the calendar month following the calendar month in which the Participant dies. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3.
</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Effective
January&nbsp;1, 2006, the second sentence of Section&nbsp;3.2(b)(1) of the Plan shall be deleted and replaced with the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Participant's Supplemental Thrift Benefit shall be distributed upon the Participant's permanent and total disability. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4.
</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
as of January&nbsp;1, 2005, a new Section&nbsp;6.10 shall be added as follows. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>6.10&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;409A  </B></FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2167326",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="3",CHK=789450,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK122:[06ATA3.06ATA1053]KL1053A.;6',USER='SCAVALI',CD='28-FEB-2006;11:15' -->
<A NAME="page_kl1053_1_2"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For deferrals subject to 409A, the Plan shall be operated in good faith compliance with Section&nbsp;409A until final Internal Revenue Service guidance is
issued. Such good faith operation shall include any requirements applicable under Section&nbsp;409A. The Plan document shall be amended and/or restated no later than the deadline prescribed by the
Internal Revenue Service (currently December&nbsp;31, 2006) to reflect all provisions required by Section&nbsp;409A and the regulations thereunder. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the Committee has adopted this Amendment Five on the date shown below, but effective as of the dates indicated above. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<TR VALIGN="TOP">

<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="26%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><B>THE COCA-COLA COMPANY<BR>
BENEFITS COMMITTEE</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
Date</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="26%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
12/21/05</FONT><HR NOSHADE></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
By</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="58%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
/s/&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>BARBARA S. GILBREATH</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.24.3
<SEQUENCE>4
<FILENAME>a2167326zex-10_243.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.24.3
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#06ATA1033_4">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_km1053_1_1"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 10.24.3  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="km1053_amendment_one_to_the_coca-cola__ame04129"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_km1053_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT ONE TO<BR>  THE COCA-COLA COMPANY DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN<BR>  As Amended and Restated Effective December&nbsp;17, 2003    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, pursuant to Section&nbsp;8.4 of The Coca-Cola Company Deferred Compensation Plan (the "Plan"), the Compensation Committee of the Board of
Directors may amend the Plan at any time; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
the American Jobs Creation Act of 2004 added new tax requirements in Internal Revenue Code (the "Code") Section&nbsp;409A, applicable to nonqualified deferred compensation
plans including the Plan; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
subsequent Internal Revenue Service guidance provided transition rules for deferrals subject to the new requirements; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
until a new Plan document is required to be adopted (currently no later than December&nbsp;31, 2006), the Plan is to be operated in good faith compliance with the new rules; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW
THEREFORE, the Plan is hereby amended to add a new Article&nbsp;IX as follows: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE IX<BR>
DEFERRALS SUBJECT TO SECTION 409A: INTERIM OPERATION<BR>
AND TRANSITION  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;409A</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
American Jobs Creation Act of 2004 added new Code Section&nbsp;409A. Certain deferrals under this Plan (generally, deferrals after December&nbsp;31, 2004) are subject to Code
Section&nbsp;409A and the regulations thereafter. This Article details certain interim transition provisions allowed by the Internal Revenue Service, and is intended to apply until a restated Plan
document is adopted. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Special Election with Respect to 2004 Bonus (Paid in March&nbsp;2005)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant
to the transition relief provided in Internal Revenue Service Notice 2005-1, the requirement in Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(4)(B) relating to timing of elections
(i.e. requiring elections to be made prior to the beginning of the taxable year in which the services are performed giving rise to the compensation) shall not be applicable to deferrals of the 2004
Bonus (paid in March&nbsp;2005), provided that the election is made prior to March&nbsp;1, 2005 and the other requirements of Notice 2005-1 are met. Eligible Employees shall be allowed
to elect to defer or increase an existing deferral election for the 2004 Incentive (paid in March&nbsp;2005) so long as such election is made no later than March&nbsp;1, 2005. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Special Revocation Election with Respect to Deferrals Subject to Section&nbsp;409A</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant
to the transition relief provided in Internal Revenue Service Notice 2005-1 and the proposed regulations under Code Section&nbsp;409A, Participants who had elected
to defer compensation subject to Code Section&nbsp;409A may revoke or reduce certain deferral elections, as outlined below: </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE WIDTH="71%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="42%" ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Item<BR> </B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="42%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Action Allowed</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="10%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>When Included<BR>
in&nbsp;Income</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="42%"><FONT SIZE=2>2004 Bonus (Paid in March 2005)</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="42%"><FONT SIZE=2>Full revocation only</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="10%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>2005</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="42%"><FONT SIZE=2>2005 Salary</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="42%"><FONT SIZE=2>Full revocation only</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="10%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>2005</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="42%"><FONT SIZE=2>2005 Bonus (Paid in March 2006)</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="42%"><FONT SIZE=2>Revocation or reduction</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="10%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>2006</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2167326",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="4",CHK=608071,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK122:[06ATA3.06ATA1053]KM1053A.;7',USER='SCAVALI',CD='28-FEB-2006;11:15' -->
<A NAME="page_km1053_1_2"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gains
and losses on deemed investments will not be applied and Participants will have no claim to any deemed gains. No interest will be paid on any amounts. Such revocation must be
elected by December&nbsp;1, 2005. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Good Faith Compliance</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
deferrals subject to Code Section&nbsp;409A, the Plan shall be operated in good faith compliance with Code Section&nbsp;409A until final Internal Revenue Service guidance is
issued. Such good faith operation shall include the plan changes outlined below which are effective for all deferrals subject to Code Section&nbsp;409A. The Plan document shall be amended and
restated no later than the deadline prescribed by the Internal Revenue Service (currently December&nbsp;31, 2006) to reflect all provisions required by Code Section&nbsp;409A and the regulations
thereunder. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="34%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Old/Grandfathered Provisions (for 2004 and earlier Plan Years)</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="34%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>New Provisions (for 2004/05, 2005 and later&nbsp;Plan&nbsp;Years)</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Nonscheduled Withdrawals</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>Nonscheduled withdrawals permitted, with a forfeiture and participation penalty.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>Nonscheduled withdrawals (other than hardship withdrawals) are not available for 2004/05 and later Plan year balances.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=5><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Changing Scheduled Distribution Elections</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>&#149; There is a limit of two changes during participation in the Plan.<BR>
&#149; The new payment start date must be at least two years later than the previous start date and made 12&nbsp;months in advance of the original payment date.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>&#149; There is no limit to the number of changes.<BR>
&#149; The new payment start date must be at least five years later than the previous start date and made 12&nbsp;months in advance of the original payment date.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=5><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Definition of "Retirement"</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>For purposes of this Plan, five years earlier than the Participant's earliest retirement date under the Company's Employee Retirement Plan (generally age&nbsp;50 with 5&nbsp;years of service or age&nbsp;55).</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>To receive balance as elected, at termination, Participant must be age&nbsp;50 with 5&nbsp;years of service or age&nbsp;55 with no service requirement. Otherwise, a lump sum is paid after termination.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=5><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Distribution Options for "Retirement"</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>Lump sum or 5, 10 or 15 annual installments, beginning after the quarter that the Participant retires or later, as long as the balance is entirely paid by the time your reach age&nbsp;85. Installments require a balance of
$50,000 or more.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>Same, except payments begin in February of the year after the year the Participant separates from service, or such later February that the Participant elects.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=5><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Changing Retirement Distribution Elections</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>One time, a Participant may collapse all of the Retirement distribution elections into one election that will govern the payment method or postpone its timing.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>&#149; Collapsing of distributions is no longer permitted.<BR>
&#149; There is no limit to the number of changes.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- insert table folio -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2167326",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="4",CHK=283344,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK122:[06ATA3.06ATA1053]KM1053A.;7',USER='SCAVALI',CD='28-FEB-2006;11:15' -->
<A NAME="page_km1053_1_3"> </A>
<!-- end of table folio -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Retirement/Termination Payment Timing</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>Distributions are paid (or installments commence) after the quarter following your termination of employment.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>&#149; Lump sums are paid (or installments commence) in February of the year following the year the Participant separates from service.<BR>
&#149; Payments to "key employees" cannot be earlier than six months after separation from service, except if due to disability, death or, possibly, a change in control of the Company.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=5><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Involuntary Termination Distribution</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>Participant could elect to receive a lump sum or 5 or 10 annual installments, with payment the quarter following termination. To receive installments, the Participant's balance must be $50,000 or more.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>Not treated as a distinct distribution event. If at termination the Participant is age 50 with 5 years of service or age 55 with no service requirement and the Participant's balance is $50,000 or more, the Participant may
receive payment in a lump sum, or 5, 10 or 15 annual installments, starting either at termination or later, provided that the balance is entirely paid by the time the Participant reaches age&nbsp;85.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=5><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Stock Option Deferrals</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>Allowed for Tier 1 under certain circumstances.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>No longer allowed.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=5><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Newly-Eligible Participants</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>Allowed to enroll only at open enrollment</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%"><FONT SIZE=2>May participate as long as deferral electives are made within 30 days.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<SEQUENCE>5
<FILENAME>a2167326zex-10_312.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.31.2
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#06ATA1033_5">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 10.31.2  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kq1053_amendment_number_one_to_the_co__ame03808"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kq1053_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT NUMBER ONE TO<BR>  THE COCA-COLA COMPANY BENEFITS PLAN<BR>  FOR MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS AMENDMENT to The Coca-Cola Company Benefits Plan for Members of the Board of Directors (the "Plan") is adopted by The Coca-Cola
Company Benefits Committee (the "Committee"). </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>W I T N E S S E T H:  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, the Plan was previously amended by instrument dated April&nbsp;15, 2003 in order to address the use and disclosure of protected health information; and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
Section&nbsp;6.01 of the Plan provides that the Committee may amend the Plan at any time; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
the Committee wishes to amend the Plan in order to correct a typographical error and to clarify certain information that is not considered to be protected health information. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW,
THEREFORE, the Committee hereby amends the Plan as follows, effective as of the dates specified herein: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
January&nbsp;1, 2006, Section&nbsp;9.04 shall be restated in its entirety to read as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"9.04&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Establishment and Maintenance of Adequate Separation between the Company and Plan</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In accordance with the
requirements of HIPAA, only the employees/classes of employees identified by the Committee or its delegate, as set forth in a separate written document maintained by the Committee or
its delegate, will be given access to PHI to be used or disclosed. Such designated persons will only have access to and use PHI for purposes of Plan administration functions that the Company performs
for the Plan. Notwithstanding the amendment provisions of this Plan, the Committee or its delegate is hereby granted authority to amend the designated persons document from time to time as necessary
to facilitate payment or health care operations of the Plan. Any such amendment to the designated persons may apply prospectively or retroactively." </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the Committee has adopted this Amendment Number One on the date shown below, but effective as of the dates indicated above. </FONT></P>

</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">

<FONT SIZE=2><A HREF="#toc_kq1053_1">AMENDMENT NUMBER ONE TO THE COCA-COLA COMPANY BENEFITS PLAN FOR MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS</A></FONT><BR>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.40
<SEQUENCE>6
<FILENAME>a2167326zex-10_40.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.40
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 10.40  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>[LETTERHEAD OF THE COCA-COLA COMPANY]  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>January&nbsp;4,
2006 </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>Mr.&nbsp;Tom
Mattia </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Dear
Tom, </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
we discussed, we are delighted to offer you the position of Senior Vice President, Public Affairs and Communications at The Coca-Cola Company. The following provides
details of the employment offer to you: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I> Compensation  </I></B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Your
base salary will be $32,500 on a monthly basis, which when annualized is $390,000.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>You
will be eligible to participate in the Company's annual incentive program. This important element of your total compensation plan is based on both individual performance
and the financial performance of the Company. Your incentive target is eighty-five percent (85%) of your base salary. For 2006, your incentive target will be at the 85% level, prorated for
the number of months you are participating in the plan and paid on total company performance for the year. Annual incentives are paid in the first quarter of the year following the plan
year&#151;for example, 2006 awards will be paid 1<SUP>st</SUP> quarter 2007.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>You
will be recommended for participation in the Company's long-term incentive program for the performance period that begins January&nbsp;1, 2007. The
Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors must approve your participation in this Plan and will do so at a Board meeting following your employment. The target value of your
long-term incentive award under this program will be approximately $1,265,000. This value may be revised from time to time and will be delivered in a combination of stock options and
performance share units. </FONT></DD></DL>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I> Relocation  </I></B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Given
that this position will be located at the Company's offices in Atlanta, Georgia, you will be eligible to participate in the Company's relocation program. Our
relocation services include assistance with house hunting, home sale and purchase, and movement of household items. In addition, you will receive 6&nbsp;months of temporary living in a furnished
apartment, and trips to Dallas every second weekend to visit your family. However, if you wish to have your family visit you in Atlanta, instead of traveling to Dallas, we would provide travel support
for up to 3 visits. In the coming weeks, you will receive a call from Linda Straw, your relocation contact
(cell:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and
office:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;), and she will help you and your family
with the relocation to Atlanta. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I> Make Whole Compensation  </I></B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>To
recognize your loss of 2005 incentive from your current employer, you will receive a one-time signing bonus equal to $195,000 gross, upon your start date. If
you should voluntarily terminate your employment or be terminated for cause prior to December&nbsp;31, 2007; you will reimburse the Company a pro-rata portion of the signing bonus.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Additionally,
a recommendation for a special one-time stock option grant of 45,000 options will be made for you at a meeting of the Compensation Committee of the
Company's Board of Directors following your employment. This special one-time stock option award will be granted to you to replace the value of unvested stock options that you will be
forfeiting upon leaving your current employer. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2167326",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="6",CHK=585585,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK122:[06ATA3.06ATA1053]KR1053A.;5',USER='SCAVALI',CD='28-FEB-2006;11:20' -->
<A NAME="page_kr1053_1_2"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>To
recognize the value of the restricted stock from your current employer that will be forfeited, you will receive a cash buyout of $445,000 gross to be paid in three equal
amounts on December&nbsp;31, 2006 ($150,000); December&nbsp;31, 2007 ($150,000); and December&nbsp;31, 2008 ($145,000); provided you are actively employed with the Company on the date of
payment. Should you voluntarily terminate your employment or be terminated for cause prior to the payment dates, the remaining balance(s) will be forfeited.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>To
recognize the forfeited service value in your current retirement plan, the Company will make special one-time payments to your Deferred Compensation account
at certain intervals, provided you are actively employed: $55,000 on July&nbsp;31, 2006; $55,000 on December&nbsp;31, 2007; and $50,000 on December&nbsp;31, 2008. Should you terminate your
employment for any reason prior to the payment dates, the remaining balance(s) will be forfeited. </FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I> Stock Ownership  </I></B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Lastly,
as a member of the senior leadership team, you will be expected to own 20,000 shares of Company stock. As part of the Company's ownership expectations, you will have
up to five years to achieve this level of ownership. </FONT></DD></DL>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I> Perquisites and Benefits  </I></B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>In
accordance with Company policy, you will be eligible for Company-paid membership and reimbursement of dues and initiation fees associated with one country
club, social club or similar club as long as the club use is for ordinary and necessary business purposes. You will be required to track and report any personal use of the Company-paid
club membership and dues. Club use that is personal is considered taxable income to the associate.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>You
will be eligible for domestic and international first class business travel in accordance with Company policy.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company provides a comprehensive Benefits Program that will be forwarded to you in a separate package. In addition, we will provide an orientation to your benefits
coverage after you begin employment.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Following
your employment, a recommendation will be made at a meeting of the Board of Directors, that you will be elected an officer of the Company and a member of the
Executive Committee. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Tom,
I am very much looking forward to having you join The Coca-Cola Company. I know that you will be a terrific addition to our team and that you will make a real difference
on this journey to create a sustainable growth business at The Coca-Cola Company. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="90%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="42%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2>Sincerely,</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="42%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
/s/&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>NEVILLE ISDELL</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="42%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
Neville Isdell<BR>

</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">

<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
offer is contingent upon our mutual agreement that this is the right opportunity for you and The Coca-Cola Company. This offer will remain open for your acceptance until
January&nbsp;15, 2006 and anticipates your becoming an employee no later than February&nbsp;16, 2006. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company is contingently liable for guarantees of indebtedness owed by third parties in the amount of approximately $248&nbsp;million. Fixed charges for these contingent liabilities have not been
included in the computation of the above ratios as the amounts are immaterial and, in the opinion of Management, it is not probable that the Company will be required to satisfy the guarantees. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lw1053_consent_of_independent___lw102345"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lw1053_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We consent to the incorporation by reference in the registration statements and related prospectuses of The Coca-Cola Company listed below of our
reports dated February&nbsp;24, 2006, with respect to the consolidated financial statements and schedule of The Coca-Cola Company, The Coca-Cola Company management's
assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting, and the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting of The Coca-Cola Company, included in this
Annual Report (Form&nbsp;10-K) for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005: </FONT></P>

<TEXT>

<HEAD>
</HEAD>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 24.1  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ks1053_power_of_attorney"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ks1053_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>POWER OF ATTORNEY    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;KNOW ALL BY THESE PRESENTS THAT I, E. NEVILLE ISDELL, Chairman of the Board, Chief Executive Officer and a Director of The Coca-Cola Company (the
"Company"), do hereby appoint GARY&nbsp;P. FAYARD, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of the Company, GEOFFREY&nbsp;J. KELLY, Senior Vice President and General Counsel of the
Company, CYNTHIA&nbsp;P. MCCAGUE, Senior Vice President of the Company, and CAROL&nbsp;C. HAYES, Associate General Counsel and Secretary of the Company, or any one of them, my true and lawful
attorneys-in-fact for me and in my name for the purpose of executing on my behalf in any and all capacities the Company's Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, or any amendment or supplement thereto, and causing such Annual Report or any such amendment or supplement to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission
pursuant to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my hand this 16th day of February&nbsp;2006. </FONT></P>

President and General Counsel of the Company, CYNTHIA P. MCCAGUE, Senior Vice President of the Company, and CAROL C. HAYES, Associate General Counsel and Secretary of the Company, or any one of them,
my true and lawful attorneys-in-fact for me and in my name for the purpose of executing on my behalf in any and all capacities the Company's Annual Report on
Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, or any amendment or supplement thereto, and causing such Annual Report or any such amendment or supplement to be filed with
the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my hand this 16th day of February&nbsp;2006. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>POWER OF ATTORNEY  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;KNOW ALL BY THESE PRESENTS THAT I, BARRY DILLER, a Director of The Coca-Cola Company (the "Company"), do hereby appoint E. NEVILLE ISDELL, Chairman of
the Board, Chief Executive Officer and a Director of the Company, GARY P. FAYARD, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of the Company, GEOFFREY J. KELLY, Senior Vice President and
General Counsel of the Company, CYNTHIA P. MCCAGUE, Senior Vice President of the Company, and CAROL C. HAYES, Associate General Counsel and Secretary of the Company, or any one of them, my true and
lawful attorneys-in-fact for
me and in my name for the purpose of executing on my behalf in any and all capacities the Company's Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, or any
amendment or supplement thereto, and causing such Annual Report or any such amendment or supplement to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to the Securities Exchange Act of
1934, as amended. </FONT></P>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-31.1
<SEQUENCE>11
<FILENAME>a2167326zex-31_1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 31.1
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#06ATA1033_11">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kc1033_exhibit_31.1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kc1033_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 31.1    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kc1033_certifications"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kc1033_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CERTIFICATIONS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>I,
E. Neville Isdell, Chairman, Board of Directors, and Chief Executive Officer of The Coca-Cola Company, certify that: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>I
have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of The Coca-Cola Company;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f))
for the registrant and have:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating
to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance
regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Disclosed
in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and
the audit committee of the registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>All
significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the
registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<TYPE>EX-31.2
<SEQUENCE>12
<FILENAME>a2167326zex-31_2.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 31.2
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#06ATA1033_12">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ke1033_exhibit_31.2"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ke1033_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 31.2    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ke1033_certifications"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ke1033_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CERTIFICATIONS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>I,
Gary P. Fayard, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of The Coca-Cola Company, certify that: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>I
have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of The Coca-Cola Company;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f))
for the registrant and have:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating
to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance
regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Disclosed
in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and
the audit committee of the registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>All
significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the
registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 32.1
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#06ATA1033_13">QuickLinks</A></FONT>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kg1033_exhibit_32.1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kg1033_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 32.1    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kg1033_certification_pursuant_to_18_u__cer03819"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kg1033_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO<BR>  18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350,<BR>  AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO<BR>  SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>In
connection with the annual report of The Coca-Cola Company (the "Company") on Form&nbsp;10-K for the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 (the "Report"), I, E. Neville
Isdell, Chairman, Board of Directors, and Chief Executive Officer of the Company and I, Gary P. Fayard, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of the Company, each certify, pursuant to
18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(1)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>to
my knowledge, the Report fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(2)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
